etymology.interpretation: Literally “wool/fur clothing,” highlighting a garment made from animal fibers like wool. In modern usage it refers to sweaters and knit pullovers.

parts.english: hair; fur; wool; tenth of a yuan

examples.chinese: 我冬天常穿毛衣(我冬天常穿毛衣)。
examples.english: I often wear a sweater in winter.

examples.chinese: 这件毛衣很保暖(這件毛衣很保暖)，颜色也很好看(顏色也很好看)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiàn máoyī hěn bǎonuǎn, yánsè yě hěn hǎokàn.
examples.english: This sweater is very warm, and the color looks great.

examples.chinese: 奶奶亲手织了毛衣(奶奶親手織了毛衣)。
examples.english: Grandma knitted a sweater by hand.
